comments.LineComment: | Each morphism's comic strip as pure data.
| No coordinates, no rendering - just structure and captions.

value.value: Zygo runs TWO folds at once - the helper feeds the main fold!
Example: Check if list is perfect (all same, and count them)
Fold 1: Count elements. Fold 2: Check all same (uses count!)
Two birds, one traversal! Perfect = (3, True)
Para is like cata, but at each step you can peek at what's left!
Computing tails: at 'c', I can see both 'c' AND [c,d]!
Regular fold only sees recursive results. Para sees the original too.
What's 4 factorial? Let's find out with hylo!
We could unfold into a list, then fold with multiplication...
But hylo is clever - it never builds the intermediate list!
4! = 24. No list was harmed in this computation!
Fold with memory of the past
Histo remembers ALL previous results, not just the last one!
Computing Fibonacci: fib(n) needs fib(n-1) AND fib(n-2)!
Histo's Cofree comonad keeps the whole history available.
fib(6) = 8, and we had access to every previous fib along the way!
Futu can generate MULTIPLE layers of structure in one step!
Regular ana: one step → one layer. Futu: one step → several!
Exchanging coins: one 15¢ → nickel + dime in ONE step!
Futu's Free comonad lets us plan ahead into the future!
Folding a structure into a value
Meet our expression tree! It computes (2 × 3) + (10 - 2).
Cata starts at the leaves. Numbers are easy - they're already values!
Finally: 6 + 8 = 14! We folded the whole tree into one value!
Apo is like ana, but can stop early and paste in a result!
At each step, we can say 'keep going' (Left) or 'I'm done!' (Right)
Insert 'x' into sorted [1,3,5]: compare, skip, compare, INSERT!
We didn't rebuild the whole list - just spliced in where needed!
Unfolding a seed into a structure
I'm the number 4. Watch me grow into a list!
The coalgebra looks at 4 and says: 'ConsF 4, then try 3!'
Each step adds an element and shrinks the seed by one.
When seed hits 0, we stop with NilF. Our list is complete!
